isis.stitle: AIR COMPRESSOR: BENDIX TU-FLO 550 AND TU-FLO 750 - DISASSEMBLE

svcsubsecinfo.para: The following disassembly and assembly procedure is presented for reference purposes and presupposes that a major rebuild of the compressor is being undertaken. Several maintenance kits are available which do not require full disassembly. When servicing this compressor with a maintenance kit, all components contained in the kit must be used. The instructions provided with these parts and kits should be followed in lieu of the instructions presented here.

Remove road dirt and grease from the exterior of the compressor with a cleaning solvent. Before the compressor is disassembled, the following items should be marked to show their relationship when the compressor is assembled. Mark the rear end cover in relation to the crankcase. Mark the base plate or base adapter in relation to the crankcase.

A convenient method to indicate the above relationships is to use a metal scribe to mark the parts with numbers or lines. Do not use marking methods such as chalk that can be wiped off or obliterated during rebuilding.

svcproc.title: CYLINDER HEAD
svcproc.para: Refer to Figure 13for all items in parentheses.

step1.para: Remove the six cylinder head capscrews (Item 1) and tap the head with a soft mallet to break the gasket seal. Remove the unloader cover plate capscrews (Item 2), lockwashers (Item 3) and the unloader cover plate (Item 4). Scrape off any gasket material (Item 5) from the cover plate, cylinder head and crankcase.
Remove the unloader pistons (Item (7), O-rings (Item 6) and springs (Item 8).

Inspect the unloader piston bushings (Item 9) for nicks, wear, corrosion and scoring. It is recommended that the compressor be replaced if it is determined that the unloader bushing is damaged or worn excessively.
Before disassembling the discharge valve mechanism, measure and record the discharge valve travel (from closed to completely open).

If the measured discharge valve travel exceeds .046 inch (1.2 mm), the compressor should be replaced. If the discharge valve travel does not exceed .046 inch (1.2 mm), use a 9/16 inch Allen wrench to remove the discharge valve seats (Item 18), valves (Item 17) and valve springs (Item 16).

Remove the inlet valve stops (Item 14), valves (Item 12), valve seats (Item 11), valve springs (Item 13) and gaskets (Item 10). It is recommended that a tool such as a Kent Moore J-25447-B be used to remove the inlet valve stop.
